stories.text:
I think the hardest job a developer is not working on issues to solve issues.

It's the dev environment setup. The easier to get environment setup done LOCALLY, the more productive developer becomes.

I joined several teams last months, and most of the issues is due to complicated for nonsense reason development setup.

Do you have similar experience ? Just curious in this case.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why complicating onboarding stuffs so hard?
The metaverse has a groping problem
Build an IoT Weather Station with Elixir, Nerves, and TimescaleDB

stories.text:
I've seen thousands of resources on Deep Learning. From books and courses, to blog posts and YT videos. I feel like there's too many resources, and I can't choose one[0].

What do you recommend to someone who's familiar with programming and is comfortable with math, but has no experience in Deep Learning?

[0]: To find the best resource, you'd have to read all of them, but that defeats the purpose!
stories.title: Ask HN: Among all resources, how should a novice start learning Deep Learning?
What if I have to make a tech decision and I don’t know the right answer? (2019)

stories.text: This has become a serious problem for me. I seem to lose focus within 5 mins of a zoom meeting or a video lecture. Trying to learn something new is becoming a pain.
